page.title: 15PERSONAL NAMES
page.content: Local children carried out a survey to record their names and those of their parents and grandparents. Some names have stayed popular; for males,{James has been consistent, with{Richard}and {John}only less so recently, when{Mark and{Stephen}have taken their places. {Margaret}also has remained popular but lately has declined,{Sarah}being the most popular girls' name in the 1980's.{Ann(e)}is a lasting favourite. Other names have been popular in one generation only; many children's parents were called{Susan,}or{Alan, names which were uncommon at other times. Their grandfathers were often called{William}or{George,}the latter almost unused since. For grandmothers, flower names, like{Lily,}were common, while{Pamela}was popular with mothers. There is a wider variety of childrens' names, with foreign ones like{Natasha.
